definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: emptying buckets and baths, and storing them upside-down.
sentences.chinese: 排空水桶和浴盆，倒置存放。

sentences.english: Cooling water flows back to the heating bucket and saves water and energy.
sentences.chinese: 冷卻水回入加熱水桶內，節能節水。

sentences.english: They also love playing with their trucks, shovels and buckets in the sandbox.
sentences.chinese: 他們也喜歡在沙坑裏玩卡車，鏟子，和水桶。

sentences.english: You can find a bucket full of water to lift.
sentences.chinese: 你可以找到一個裝滿水的水桶來做舉重。

sentences.english: Since sleep debt also leads to obesity, his pot belly is not a surprise to us.
sentences.chinese: 缺覺會導致肥胖，所以我們習慣了他的水桶腰。

sentences.english: The bottom of the bucket is clean knocked cut.
sentences.chinese: 水桶底兒一古腦兒地都磕掉了。

sentences.english: The water butt catches the overflow from this pipe.
sentences.chinese: 大水桶盛接管子裏流出的東西。

sentences.english: Wilbur didn't care. He kept walking toward the pail of slops.
sentences.chinese: 威爾伯不在意，繼續朝泔水桶走去。

sentences.english: The boy took a bucket and a net with him.
sentences.chinese: 他帶上了一個水桶和一個網罩。

sentences.english: Many people in the U. S. are over-weight; they are as round as barrels.
sentences.chinese: 在美國許多人身體超重，他們胖得像水桶。

sentences.english: Bring me a washbasin and a pail.
sentences.chinese: 給我拿一個臉盆和一個水桶。

sentences.english: The standard of beautiful woman in Tang Dynasty, the double chins and bucket waist.
sentences.chinese: 那個年代的審美標準，雙下頦，水桶腰。

sentences.english: There is a stack of hay a leaky barrel in the discard barn.
sentences.chinese: 在廢棄的牲口棚中有一堆乾草和一個漏的水桶。

sentences.english: Seeing the barrel was empty, I decided to fetch water from the well.
sentences.chinese: 看到水桶是空的，我就決定去井邊打水。

sentences.english: Dudu bear and Maomao cat are beside the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 嘟嘟熊和毛毛球在水桶旁邊。

definition: washbowl/basin for washing hands and face/CL:個|个[ge4]
washbowl/basin for washing hands and face
to ladle water/to scoop up water
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
